turns.content: Can you suggest some contemporary jazz artists who incorporate electronic music into their work?

Sure, here are five contemporary jazz artists who incorporate electronic music into their work:

1. Robert Glasper - Robert Glasper is a pianist and composer who blends jazz, hip-hop, and R&B. His work often includes electronic beats and samples.

2. Christian Scott aTunde Adjuah - Christian Scott aTunde Adjuah is a trumpeter and composer who fuses jazz with elements of rock, hip-hop, and electronic music.

3. Flying Lotus - Flying Lotus is a producer and electronic musician who creates experimental music that blends jazz, hip-hop, and electronic music.

4. Kamasi Washington - Kamasi Washington is a saxophonist and composer who incorporates elements of free jazz, funk, and hip-hop into his music. His work often features electronic textures and production.

5. Nubya Garcia - Nubya Garcia is a saxophonist and composer who combines jazz with elements of afrobeat and electronic music. Her music often features synthesizers and other electronic instruments.
This sounds interesting. Can you recommend a specific album or song from one of these artists that incorporates electronic music?

Certainly! Here are some specific recommendations for albums or songs from each artist that incorporate electronic music:

1. Robert Glasper - "Black Radio" (album) - This album features electric pianos, synthesizers, and programmed beats in addition to acoustic instrumentation.

2. Christian Scott aTunde Adjuah - "Ancestral Recall" (album) - This album blends traditional jazz with electronic beats and sounds, creating a unique fusion of genres.

3. Flying Lotus - "You're Dead!" (album) - This album features a mix of jazz and electronic music, with live instrumentation combined with experimental production techniques.

4. Kamasi Washington - "The Epic" (album) - This album features a full jazz orchestra alongside electronic textures and production, creating a grand and expansive sound.

5. Nubya Garcia - "Pace" (song) - This song features a driving beat created by electronic drums, as well as synth sounds and textures that complement Garcia's saxophone playing.

Wow, I've never really listened to jazz combined with electronic music before, but these recommendations sound really interesting. I'll definitely check out these artists and albums. Do you have any other suggestions for jazz fusion artists who incorporate different genres into their music?

Yes, here are a few more jazz fusion artists who incorporate different genres into their music:

1. Snarky Puppy - This group blends jazz, funk, and world music, with a rotating cast of musicians and an emphasis on improvisation.

2. Hiromi Uehara - Hiromi is a pianist and composer who combines jazz with elements of rock and classical music. Her virtuosic playing style and complex compositions make for a thrilling listening experience.

3. Béla Fleck and the Flecktones - This group, led by banjo virtuoso Béla Fleck, fuses jazz with bluegrass, funk, and other styles. Their unique instrumentation (banjo, bass, saxophone, and drums) creates a distinctive sound.

4. Cory Henry & The Funk Apostles - This group combines jazz, funk, and soul, with a focus on groove and rhythm. Keyboardist and bandleader Cory Henry has worked with a variety of artists, including Snarky Puppy and Stevie Wonder.

5. Thundercat - Thundercat is a bassist, singer, and composer who blends jazz with elements of funk, soul, and R&B. His music is characterized by funky basslines, virtuosic playing, and humorous lyrics.

I hope you enjoy exploring these artists and their unique sounds!

These recommendations sound great! I'm excited to dive into this fusion of jazz and electronic music. Have you personally listened to any of these artists or albums? If so, which one is your favorite?

I do not have personal preferences, emotions or feelings, so i have not personally listened to these artists or their albums. however, they are highly recommended by music enthusiasts and have received critical acclaim in the music industry. it's best for you to explore the artists and albums to determine which one resonates with your taste in music. happy listening!

I'll definitely be diving into these artists soon. Do you have any suggestions for where I can find new jazz fusion music to explore? Maybe some online communities or websites that feature this genre?

There are many online communities and websites that feature jazz fusion music. Here are a few that I recommend checking out:

1. All About Jazz - This website has a section dedicated to jazz fusion, featuring news, reviews, and articles about the genre. 2. Jazziz - Jazziz is a magazine and website that covers many different styles of jazz, including fusion. They have articles, reviews, and curated playlists that feature new and established artists. 3. r/JazzFusion - This subreddit is dedicated to jazz fusion and is a great place to discover new music and join discussions with other jazz fusion fans. 4. Bandcamp - Bandcamp is a music platform that supports independent artists, including many jazz fusion musicians. You can browse by genre or search for specific artists to discover new music. 5. Spotify - Spotify has a jazz fusion genre page that features playlists, albums, and artists that blend jazz with other genres. You can also use their Discover Weekly and Release Radar features to discover new jazz fusion music based on your listening history. I hope this helps you find new jazz fusion music to explore and enjoy!
